title.narrative: 06.1 NATIONAL POLICY AND STRATEGIES

description.narrative: 2014-16 Output 6.1: By 2016, national and provincial authorities have the capacity to develop a national nutrition strategy, action plans and updated guidelines.Old 2011-2013 Intermediate Results (IR) 9.1 By 2015, National and Provincial Government capacity to develop and institutionalize policies and strategy framework/plan for effective implementation of child and maternal nutrition programme., which contributes to Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2013 - 2016 Outcome 06: By 2016, the Government implements a comprehensive sustainable nutrition programme including adequate Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF), Micronutrients and Management of Acute Malnutrition programmes2011 - 2013 Programme Component Results (PCR) 9: By 2015, child and maternal nutrition improved at local and national levels. (By 2015, the Government implement a comprehensive sustainable nutrition programme including adequate Infant and Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients and Management of Acute Malnutrition programs)

Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2014-16 Output 6.1: By 2016, national and provincial authorities have the capacity to develop a national nutrition strategy,action plans and updated guidelines.Old 2011-2013 IR 9.1 By 2015, National and Provincial Government capacity to develop andinstitutionalize policies and strategy framework/plan for effective implementation of child and maternal nutrition programme.

description.narrative: Nutrition services were expanded to hospitals in 189 (of 210) counties, 15 children hospitals, 14 baby homes and seven districts. A Nutrition-WASH toolkit was introduced. DPRK was the first country in East Asia and the Pacific to develop Theory of Change for an integrated approach to maximize outcomes. | Status:Met | As-of Date:09/01/2017

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Jan 1 2017) Nutrition sector plan or policy that includes a risk management strategy to address disaster/crisis risk available

actual.value: 2017:National nutrition strategy and action plan 2014-18 is operational

title.narrative: 6.1.b. CMAM, IYCF and micronutrient (MN) guidelines are finalised

actual.value: 2017:ECD and Complementary Feeding guidelines for nurseries developed in 2016

title.narrative: 6.1.a. The national strategy and its action plan are finalised

actual.value: 2017:In order to break the intergenerational cycle of undernutrition in DPRK, UNICEF presented ‘Women's nutrition: a review of evidence and actions for UNICEF' to the national technical committee. Subsequently, the Government agreed to revise the National Nutrition Strategy and Action Plan for 2014–2018

title.narrative: 6.1.b. CMAM, IYCF and micronutrient (MN) guidelines are finalised
6.1.c. National IDD action plan finalised

actual.value: 2017:The programme provided technical inputs and facilitated three national workshops to develop the national universal salt iodization action plan by the technical committee of the State Planning Commission, ICN, MoPH, the Quality Control and Quality Assurance Commission, GPSH, the Salt Bureau and other

title.narrative: 6.1.c. National IDD action plan finalised

actual.value: 2017:The programme provided technical inputs and facilitated three national workshops to develop the national universal salt iodization action plan by the technical committee of the State Planning Commission, ICN, MoPH, the Quality Control and Quality Assurance Commission, GPSH, the Salt Bureau and other
